alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 6:12PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Yolo, eastern Colusa, northwestern Sutter, central Glenn and southwestern Yuba Counties through 700 PM PDT... At 611 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elk Creek to near Cranmore. Movement was northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Willows, Maxwell, Elk Creek, Colusa, College City, Delevan, Cranmore, Stoney Gorge Reservoir, Meridian, Tisdale, Sycamore, Fruto, Colusa National Wildlife, Chrome, Sutter, Williams and Arbuckle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Southern Sacramento Valley
